title: GOT's Maisie Williams promotes her startup Daisie at TechCrunch Disrupt in San Francisco
text:
She found fame as Arya Stark on HBO's Game Of Thrones.

But Maisie Williams is also a tech entrepreneur as well as an actress.

On Thursday, the 22-year-old was a participant at TechCrunch Disrupt, a networking conference for the tech industry's leading innovators and venture capitalists.

Tech: She found fame as Arya Stark on HBO's Game Of Thrones. But Maisie Williams is also an entrepreneur and on Thursday, she was a participant at TechCrunch Disrupt in San Francisco

Williams took the stage to talk about her startup Daisie, an app that connects creatives across the arts.

The British star chose an all-black ensemble for her appearance pairing a turtleneck and jeans.

Her chin-length bob with bangs was sleekly styled.

Her passion: Williams, 22, took the stage to talk about her startup Daisie , an app that connects creatives across the arts

Startup: Daisie has more than 100,000 members from the film, music, fashion and acting industries and pairs up collaborators who lend their talent and skills to each other's projects

Focused: The British star chose an all-black ensemble for her appearance pairing a turtleneck and jeans with frayed cuffs. Her chin-length bob with bangs was sleekly styled

Daisie has more than 100,000 members from film, music, fashion, photography and acting industries.

It had an initial seed round of $2.5 million and, Williams said, she'll be looking soon to raise another round of funding.

The focus of the app is to pair up collaborators who can lend their talent and skills to each other's projects.

Looking for investors: Her startup had an initial seed round of $2.5 million and, Williams said Thursday, she'll be looking soon to raise another round of funding

Meanwhile, Williams, who was cast on Game Of Thrones when she was 14, has revealed in an interview with Vogue that playing Sansa left her feeling 'ashamed' of her body.

'Around season two or three my body started to mature and I started to become a woman, but Arya was still very much like trying to be disguised as a boy,' she explained.

'I had to have really short hair and they'd constantly cover me in dirt sand, shade my nose so it looked really broad and I looked really manly,' the actress went on.

'They'd also put this strap across my chest to flatten any growth that had started and that just felt horrible for six months of the year, and I felt kind of ashamed for a while.'

Next up, she'll be seen on the big screen in The New Mutants, set for release in April, 2020.
description: The British star, 22, chose an all-black ensemble for her appearance pairing a turtleneck and jeans. Her chin-length bob with bangs was sleekly styled.
